subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] #37 and #40 in BPJ2
msgSnippet: OK, I ll update my spreadsheet tonight. I ll also regenerate the QM page 25 comparisons. I may to try to talk you out of this one. As I said earlier, I d
messageBody:
OK, I'll update my spreadsheet tonight. I'll also regenerate the QM
page 25 comparisons.

I may to try to talk you out of this one. As I said earlier, I'd
really like to see U remain assigned to #40. This is a pure vowel, a
monophthong. B just doesn't work for it, I think. Meanwhile, #37 is a
diphthong, and we can't expect to have such good assignments for
those.

Have you given any thought to swapping #43 and #44?

Ted


On Jan 8, 2008 9:47 AM, Benct Philip Jonsson <bpj@...> wrote:
>
>
>
>
>
>
> I just realized another thing which speaks in favor of switching #37
> to U and #40 to B: #40 B and #39 U will be mapped to uppercase letters
> which are next to each other on the keyboard. At the same time #37 U
> will be mapped to the uppercase letter corresponding to the mapping
> for #36 u. These are strong arguments for the swap even if there
> weren't the fact that U is part of the standard TO graphy for #37 and
> that a rotated B looks like the standard TO graphy for #40.
>
> I think we can consider the swap of BPJ2 #37 to U and #40 to B done.
> Will you all Ted, Moira and Anthony please update your reference
> documents. I will update mine tomorrow.
>
> /BP
>
> --
> / BP
>
